intro: Calceolaria triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance. Calceolaria triloba is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is known for its delicate and ephemeral blooms.
